name: Metasploit Default
description: Default reverse shell listener port for Metasploit Framework

name: Metasploit Reverse
description: Alternate Metasploit reverse handler port

name: Cobalt Strike
description: Default Cobalt Strike team server listener port

name: Back Orifice
description: Classic Back Orifice remote access trojan default port

name: Elite / Generic Backdoor
description: Common backdoor port associated with various malware families

name: HTTPS Alternate / C2
description: Alternative HTTPS port commonly used by C2 frameworks including Cobalt Strike

name: HTTP Proxy / C2
description: Common HTTP proxy port also used by C2 frameworks and web shells

name: RDP
description: Remote Desktop Protocol - legitimate but frequently targeted for unauthorized access

name: VNC
description: Virtual Network Computing default port - remote desktop access

name: WinRM HTTP
description: Windows Remote Management over HTTP - PowerShell remoting

name: WinRM HTTPS
description: Windows Remote Management over HTTPS - PowerShell remoting

name: SSH
description: Secure Shell - unusual on Windows unless OpenSSH is intentionally installed

name: DNS Tunneling
description: DNS port - unexpected listeners may indicate DNS tunneling for data exfiltration

name: IRC / Backdoor
description: IRC port commonly used by IRC-based botnets and backdoors

name: IRC Default
description: Default IRC port used by botnet command-and-control channels

name: IRC SSL
description: IRC over TLS/SSL - used by encrypted botnet communications

name: Tor Default ORPort
description: Default Tor relay ORPort - may indicate Tor relay or hidden service

name: Tor SOCKS
description: Default Tor SOCKS proxy port - indicates Tor client is running

name: Tor Control
description: Tor control port for managing Tor process programmatically

name: Generic Backdoor
description: Common backdoor port used by various trojans and reverse shells

name: NetBus
description: NetBus remote access trojan default port

name: Sub7
description: Sub7 (SubSeven) remote access trojan default port

name: SOCKS Proxy
description: SOCKS proxy port - may indicate proxy pivoting or tunneling

name: HTTP Proxy (Squid)
description: Common HTTP proxy port - may indicate traffic interception or pivoting

name: Splinter C2
description: Port used by several C2 frameworks as alternate HTTPS listener

name: Alternate SSH
description: Alternative SSH port commonly used to avoid detection

name: Backdoor Variant
description: Variant of the classic 1337/31337 backdoor ports

name: Alternate HTTPS / C2
description: Alternate HTTPS port used by Meterpreter and other C2 payloads

name: Alternate HTTP / C2
description: Alternate HTTP port used by various C2 frameworks

name: Meterpreter
description: Alternate Meterpreter handler port

name: Poisoned Handler
description: Common port used in advanced persistent threat toolkits
